intro: Anil umbonata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often with a compact rosette structure. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hairs, while its flowers come in a variety of colors including purple, pink, and white. Anil umbonata thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
